channel.title: MYB
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MYB, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: In The U.S., Private Well Water More Likely To Have High Levels Of Heavy Metals
item.description: A pilot study of close to 200 pet dogs in homes that use private wells as their main source of water found that at least two-thirds of those dogs were...

item.title: Chogokin Metal Gear REX Toy Gets A February Release Date
item.description: After the initial tease from Bandai Spirits about a Chogokin Metal Gear REX toy, we now have more details on it, including a February release date.

item.title: Japan Post Has Temporarily Suspended Mail To The US Due To Tariffs
item.description: Following the ongoing international tariff situation, Japan Post has temporarily suspended its mail service to the US until some kind of clarity is re...

item.title: Musk Vs. OpenAI — And Apple: Can xAI Turn A Culture-War Into An Antitrust Win?
item.description: Elon Musk’s xAI sues Apple and OpenAI, alleging their ChatGPT integration on iPhones locks out rivals like Grok.

item.title: Rare Shark Found Again After Half A Century Near Papua New Guinea
item.description: Scientists have rediscovered the sailback houndshark (Gogolia filewoodi), a species not seen since the 1970s, off northern Papua New Guinea.

item.title: For people who don’t care that much
item.description: If someone snuck into my closet and switched out one brand of sneakers for a similar model from another company, it wouldn’t bother me much. Popular c...

item.title: Confusing good luck with skill
item.description: If 1,000 people toss a fair coin three times, 125 of them will get three heads in a row. Perfect score. And 125 will lose every time. We probably shou...

item.title: Mirrors and hats
item.description: No one buys a hat without looking at themselves in a mirror first. Ever. There were hats before there were mirrors, so I’m not sure how it used to be,...

item.title: Job churn
item.description: Since I was born, humans have created 6 billion jobs. All while technology relentlessly disrupts existing industries. The pin making machine replaced ...

item.title: “GET OUTTA MY WAY”
item.description: Pedestrian traffic in Grand Central Station is a bit of a miracle. Thousands of people, all walking quickly, in almost non-Euclidian chaos, headed tow...
